description.narrative: The key development problem which this joint project aims to resolve is the desertification leading to loss of livelihoods poverty and forced migration. The development goal is the sustainable use of natural resources and secured livelihood in the project areas. The project started in 2012 and is planned for 10 years. This is its 3rd phase. The outcomes are:1. Soil and water conservation enhanced2. Pressure on natural vegetation decreased3. Existing environmental centers developed into regional hubs4. Colla boration and partnerships between local national and international actors in environmental sector strengthenedThe principal activities include- awareness raising programs media campaigns- workshops on energy saving stove making and usage trainings for char coal producers on sustainable production- seedling production indigenous tree seed collection promotion of agro-forestry practices- promotion of natural regeneration- joint meetings workshops with authoritiesThe project addresses several human rights and e nhances everybody?s right to a standard of living adequate for the well-being. Even though the environment doesn?t fit neatly into any category of human rights it is considered as a pre-requisite for enjoyment of human rights. The project promotes gender e quality by enabling the participation of women in trainings and activities. By finding sustainable solutions to environmental problems and by helping people to adapt to the climate change the project reduces inequality considerably.The project is implement ed at 3 sites with the FSN's 4 partners in Finland and 3 NGO partners in Somalia. The innovative cooperative model enforces the civil society in Somalia and creates new networks promoting in that way also peace and stability.The beneficiaries include famil ies farmers and women participating in trainings charcoal producers and traders regional administrations students teachers and volunteers. The final beneficiaries are the local communities at large 347 000 persons who benefit from the better condition of t he environment which will improve their livelihood in general.
